intro: Dalechampia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed huito, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaf structure and inflorescence. The plant features large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter, often with a velvety texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in a spadix, enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. Dalechampia triloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
